Issues.Title: Make `$(Architecture)` initialization resilient against pre-set values in `$env`
Issues.Body:
See https://github.com/cmderdev/cmder/issues/2290 for details. 

> I was building [dotnet/wpf](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf) just now and noticed that it had trouble building correctly.
> 
> I debugged it down to [these lines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/878a6b748b66c6dc464dd50753fff5e5a2e6acdb/eng/WpfArcadeSdk/tools/Wpf.Cpp.props#L19-L21) that fail to initialize the MSBuild property `$(Architecture)` correctly (it's initialized to `64` instead of `x64`), which in turn lead to my (dev) build failures in **dotnet/wpf**.
> 
> ```
>     <Architecture Condition="'$(Platform)'=='x64' or '$(Platform)'=='x86' or '$(Platform)'=='arm' or '$(Platform)'=='arm64'">$(Platform)</Architecture>
>     <Architecture Condition="'$(Platform)'=='Win32'">x86</Architecture>
>     <Architecture Condition="'$(Architecture)'==''">x64</Architecture>
> ```
> 

**cmder** sets `$env:architecture` to values like `32`, `64`, which confuses this logic. 

https://github.com/cmderdev/cmder/blob/1071221468f2f75f2b63e482deab69c9ca986219/vendor/init.bat#L125-L132
```
:: Pick right version of clink
if "%PROCESSOR_ARCHITECTURE%"=="x86" (
    set architecture=86
    set architecture_bits=32
) else (
    set architecture=64
    set architecture_bits=64
)
```

This only affects dev-builds, and only on some alternate-consoles. Still the fix is trivial and we can make this logic a bit resilient.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Make `$(Architecture)` initialization resilient against pre-set values in `$env`" (#2842)

Issues.Title: WPF NetCore 3.1 Application crashes with StackoOverflow at Runtime
Issues.Body:
* .NET Core Version: 3.1.200
* Windows version: 1909 (OS Build 18363.720)
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: Yes
* Is this bug related specifically to tooling in Visual Studio (e.g. XAML Designer, Code editing, etc...)? - No... it a runtime issue
* Security issues and bugs should be reported privately, learn more via our [responsible disclosure guidelines](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/README.md#reporting-security-issues-and-security-bugs).

 <!-- Read https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/blob/master/Documentation/issue-guide.md -->
 
 **Problem description:** 
All details are in VS Feedback : https://developercommunity.visualstudio.com/content/problem/964428/40396-designer-process-terminated-unexpectedly.html

 **Actual behavior:** <!-- callstack for crashes / exceptions -->
Application crash 

 **Expected behavior:**
 NO crash

 **Minimal repro:**

Issues.Title: WebBrowser crashes with low probability
Issues.Body:
**OS Version**: Windows 10 Enterprise, 64-bit, build 18363
**.NET Framework**: 4.7.2

**What we do**:
We use a WebBrowser control in our application. The WebBrowser source is a local HTML file. We call WebBrowser.InvokeScript method to generate a canvas on the html page and get the canvas base64 data. Then we use the base64 data to create a bitmap image on WPF application and show it for our end-user. 

**What happens**:
It behaves well at most time. But our application **crashes with low probability**. We found the call stack in Windows Events. 
`Application: Forguncy.exe
Framework Version: v4.0.30319
Description: The process was terminated due to an unhandled exception.
Exception Info: exception code c0000005, exception address 00007FF936B14B36
Stack:
   at MS.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods+IDispatchEx.InvokeEx(Int32, Int32, Int32, DISPPARAMS, System.Object ByRef, EXCEPINFO, IServiceProvider)
   at MS.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods+IDispatchEx.InvokeEx(Int32, Int32, Int32, DISPPARAMS, System.Object ByRef, EXCEPINFO, IServiceProvider)
   at System.Windows.Controls.WebBrowser.InvokeScript(System.String, System.Object[])
   at Forguncy.Common.ListViewPreviewer.InvokeScript(System.String, System.String)
   at Forguncy.Common.ListViewPreviewer+<>c__DisplayClass17_1.<GetListViewPreviewResult>b__0()
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeDelegateCore()
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.InvokeImpl()
   at MS.Internal.CulturePreservingExecutionContext.CallbackWrapper(System.Object)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.RunInternal(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object, Boolean)
   at System.Threading.ExecutionContext.Run(System.Threading.ExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object)
   at MS.Internal.CulturePreservingExecutionContext.Run(MS.Internal.CulturePreservingExecutionContext, System.Threading.ContextCallback, System.Object)
   at System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherOperation.Invoke()
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.ProcessQueue()
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.WndProcHook(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr, Boolean ByRef)
   at MS.Win32.HwndWrapper.WndProc(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr, Boolean ByRef)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.DispatcherCallbackOperation(System.Object)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.InternalRealCall(System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
   at System.Windows.Threading.ExceptionWrapper.TryCatchWhen(System.Object, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32, System.Delegate)
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.LegacyInvokeImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherPriority, System.TimeSpan, System.Delegate, System.Object, Int32)
   at MS.Win32.HwndSubclass.SubclassWndProc(IntPtr, Int32, IntPtr, IntPtr)
   at MS.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Interop.MSG ByRef)
   at MS.Win32.UnsafeNativeMethods.DispatchMessage(System.Windows.Interop.MSG ByRef)
   at System.Windows.Threading.Dispatcher.PushFrameImpl(System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherFrame)
   at System.Windows.Application.RunDispatcher(System.Object)
   at System.Windows.Application.RunInternal(System.Windows.Window)
   at Forguncy.Program.InitializeMain(System.Action, Boolean)
   at Forguncy.Program.Main(System.String[])`

The exception will make our application crashes. So could you help me to solve it?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "WebBrowser crashes with low probability" (#2828)

Issues.Title: App.xaml resources can't be found when using a custom entry point
Issues.Body:
[TestNetCoreWpfResources.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4407461/TestNetCoreWpfResources.zip)
* .NET Core Version: 3.1
* Windows version: 1803
* Does the bug reproduce also in WPF for .NET Framework 4.8?: No

 **Problem description:**
App.xaml resources can't be found when configuring a custom entry point with _StartupObject_ and using _new App().Run()_. 
_Application.ApplicationMarkupBaseUri_ is not set to _App.xaml_.

 **Actual behavior:**
 All resources and MergedDictionaries' resources described in the _App.xaml_ can't be found.

 **Expected behavior:**
Expected the resources and MergedDictionaries' resources described in the _App.xaml_ to be available the application.

 **Minimal repro:**

_csproj_
```
[TestNetCoreWpfResources.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/files/4407453/TestNetCoreWpfResources.zip)

<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk.WindowsDesktop">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <OutputType>WinExe</OutputType>
    <TargetFramework>netcoreapp3.1</TargetFramework>
    <UseWPF>true</UseWPF>
    <StartupObject>TestNetCoreWpfResources.Program</StartupObject>
  </PropertyGroup>
</Project>
```

_Program.cs_
```
[STAThread]
private static void Main(string[] args)
{
	//App.Main(); // This works
	
	var app = new App { ShutdownMode = ShutdownMode.OnExplicitShutdown }; // This doesn't

	// Work around?
	//var appWideResources = new ResourceDictionary { Source = new Uri("pack://application:,,,/TestNetCoreWpfResources;component/AppResources.xaml") };
	//foreach (var resource in appWideResources.MergedDictionaries) Application.Current.Resources.MergedDictionaries.Add(resource);

	var wnd = new MainWindow();
	wnd.Title = "Test App.xaml resources";
	app.Run(wnd);
}
```
_App.xaml_
```
<Application.Resources>
     <ResourceDictionary>

        <DrawingGroup x:Key="DrawingGroupSettings">
            <GeometryDrawing Brush="#FFF6F6F6" Geometry="F1M32,64C30.85,64,29.646,63.926,28.322,63.773L25.844,63.492 22.666,54.551 14.102,58.617 12.15,57.074C10.223,55.547,8.467,53.795,6.93,51.855L5.381,49.902 9.449,41.34 0.507999999999999,38.16 0.225000000000001,35.684C0.0740000000000016,34.355 0,33.152 0,32 0,30.848 0.0740000000000016,29.645 0.225000000000001,28.316L0.507999999999999,25.84 9.449,22.66 5.381,14.098 6.93,12.145C8.467,10.209,10.223,8.449,12.15,6.926L14.102,5.383 22.666,9.449 25.844,0.508000000000003 28.322,0.226999999999997C29.646,0.0739999999999981 30.85,0 32,0 33.16,0 34.367,0.0739999999999981 35.691,0.226999999999997L38.166,0.515999999999998 41.342,9.449 49.902,5.383 51.854,6.926C53.785,8.459,55.543,10.215,57.074,12.148L58.619,14.102 54.551,22.66 63.492,25.84 63.775,28.316C63.926,29.645 64,30.848 64,32 64,33.152 63.926,34.355 63.775,35.684L63.492,38.16 54.551,41.34 58.619,49.898 57.074,51.848C55.543,53.785,53.785,55.545,51.854,57.07L49.902,58.617 41.342,54.551 38.164,63.484 35.691,63.773C34.367,63.926,33.16,64,32,64" />
            <GeometryDrawing Brush="#FF424242" Geometry="F1M32,26C28.687,26 26,28.688 26,32 26,35.313 28.687,38 32,38 35.313,38 38,35.313 38,32 38,28.688 35.313,26 32,26 M32,20C25.371,20 20,25.371 20,32 20,38.629 25.371,44 32,44 38.629,44 44,38.629 44,32 44,25.371 38.629,20 32,20 M50.855,38.41C50.574,39.238,50.254,40.035,49.871,40.813L53.938,49.367C52.598,51.059,51.066,52.594,49.371,53.934L40.813,49.867C40.039,50.254,39.238,50.57,38.41,50.855L35.23,59.797C34.168,59.922 33.094,60 32,60 30.91,60 29.836,59.922 28.777,59.801L25.598,50.855C24.77,50.574,23.965,50.254,23.191,49.871L14.633,53.938C12.937,52.594,11.406,51.063,10.062,49.367L14.129,40.813C13.746,40.035,13.426,39.238,13.145,38.41L4.199,35.227C4.078,34.168 4,33.094 4,32 4,30.906 4.078,29.832 4.199,28.77L13.145,25.59C13.426,24.762,13.746,23.963,14.129,23.187L10.062,14.629C11.406,12.937,12.937,11.402,14.633,10.062L23.191,14.129C23.965,13.742,24.766,13.426,25.598,13.141L28.777,4.199C29.836,4.078 30.91,4 32,4 33.094,4 34.168,4.078 35.23,4.199L38.41,13.145C39.238,13.426,40.039,13.746,40.813,14.129L49.371,10.062C51.066,11.406,52.598,12.937,53.938,14.633L49.871,23.187C50.254,23.963,50.574,24.762,50.855,25.59L59.801,28.77C59.922,29.832 60,30.906 60,32 60,33.094 59.922,34.168 59.801,35.227z" />
            <GeometryDrawing Brush="#FFF0EFF1" Geometry="F1M32,38C28.684,38 26,35.312 26,32 26,28.687 28.684,26 32,26 35.316,26 38,28.687 38,32 38,35.312 35.316,38 32,38 M32,20C25.371,20 20,25.371 20,32 20,38.627 25.371,44 32,44 38.629,44 44,38.627 44,32 44,25.371 38.629,20 32,20" />
        </DrawingGroup>

        <DrawingImage x:Key="DrawingImageSettings" Drawing="{StaticResource DrawingGroupSettings}"/>

        <Canvas x:Key="CanvasSettings" Width="16" Height="16" x:Shared="false">
            <Rectangle Width="16" Height="16">
                <Rectangle.Fill>
                    <DrawingBrush Drawing="{StaticResource DrawingGroupSettings}" />
                </Rectangle.Fill>
            </Rectangle>
        </Canvas>

    </ResourceDictionary>
</Application.Resources>
```
_MainWindow.xaml_
```
<Menu>
    <MenuItem Header="_MenuItem with Icon" Icon="{DynamicResource CanvasSettings}" />
</Menu>
<Label x:Name="labelApplicationMarkupBaseUri"/>
```
_MainWindow.xaml.cs_

```
var app = Application.Current;
var baseUri = app.GetType().GetProperty("ApplicationMarkupBaseUri",
		System.Reflection.BindingFlags.Public |
		System.Reflection.BindingFlags.NonPublic | System.Reflection.BindingFlags.Instance).GetValue(app, null);

labelApplicationMarkupBaseUri.Content = baseUri.ToString();
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "App.xaml resources can't be found when using a custom entry point" (#2823)
